treatment.description: Perennials or subshrubs (usually in rock crevices, stems often brittle). Involucres cylindric, narrowly funnelform, or campanulate, 6–12 × 3–15 mm. Ray florets 0. Disc florets 5–150; corollas cream, yellow, or white. Cypselae oblong to narrowly oblanceolate, partially flattened to subcylindric, usually somewhat rounded or angled on 1 or both faces, margins inconspicuously calloused, almost glabrous or short-hairy; pappi of 8–35 unequal, antrorsely barbellulate bristles 0.5–3.5 mm (in P. vitreomontana all but 2–3 may be reduced to vestigial nubs). x = 17.

references.reference: Powell, A. M. 1969. Taxonomy of Perityle, section Pappothrix (Compositae–Peritylanae). Rhodora 71: 58–93.
